definition: to carry (hanging down from the hand)/to lift/to put forward/to mention/to raise (an issue)/upwards character stroke/lifting brush stroke (in painting)/scoop for measuring liquid

sentences.english: I left the lantern outside and went near to his bed.
sentences.chinese: 我把提燈留在門外，自己走到他的牀邊。

sentences.english: She lit a decorative lantern, and its soft light bathed the room.
sentences.chinese: 她點燃了一盞裝飾用的提燈，溫柔的光線沐浴着房間。

sentences.english: The off-duty watch relaxed under a lantern after the squall .
sentences.chinese: 狂風過後，下了班的值夜人員在一盞提燈下憩息。

sentences.english: The off-duty watch relaxed under a lantern after the squall.
sentences.chinese: 狂風過後，下了班的值夜人員在一盞提燈下憩息。

sentences.english: Someone in the next room had lit a dark-lantern.
sentences.chinese: 隔壁房間有人點燃了一盞昏暗的提燈。

sentences.english: With lantern and with ladder he comes posting up the street.
sentences.chinese: 李利拿着提燈和梯子走來了，把街燈點亮。

sentences.english: Have you also heard of the story of the "Lady of the Lamp"?
sentences.chinese: 你還聽說過“提燈女士”的故事吧？

sentences.english: The old man used a kerosene lantern.
sentences.chinese: 老人過去用一盞煤油提燈。

sentences.english: Tootie looked at the lanterns that had been lighted and placed near the opening.
sentences.chinese: 圖蒂望着那些已經點着並放在洞口附近的提燈。

sentences.english: I returned to get my lantern and went back to his bed.
sentences.chinese: 我轉身拿到提燈，再走回到他牀邊。

definition: to appreciate/to take pleasure in/to enjoy
the multitudes come out from everywhere, emptying every alleyway (to celebrate)/the whole town turns out
to parade sb through the streets/to march or parade in the streets
to spin a web (spider)/to weave a net (e.g. for fishing)
